content.body: returning skips the rest of the callback, but not subsequent iterations, because they're different runs of the callback
the issue only comes when porting code that uses a for loop to code using `forEach`
content.formatted_body: the issue only comes when porting code that uses a for loop to code using forEach

content.body: I suspect what they're asking for is for the article to point out you cannot break out of the loop.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I suspect what they're asking for is for the article to point out you cannot break out of the loop.

content.body:
There is already a section for this that says: "There is no way to stop or break a forEach() loop other than by throwing an exception"
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/forEach#sect2
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text:
There is already a section for this that says: "There is no way to stop or break a forEach() loop other than by throwing an exception"
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/forEach#sect2

content.body: maybe it could be even more explicit?
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: maybe it could be even more explicit?
